update.description:
This pull request allows the `SimulationRunner` to fall back to a default plugin configuration when one is not specified either via the `ServerConfig` \(via `ign-launch`\) or in the `.sdf` file.

If plugins aren’t found, it will search, in order:

1. A file located at  environment variable `IGN_GAZEBO_DEFAULT_SYSTEMS`
2. A file located at `~/.ignition/gazebo/systems.config`
3. A file located at `${IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR}/systems/systems.config`

The format of the file is similar to how plugins are specified in `ign-launch`

One additional update is that a wildcard entity name is now supported for the world entity type, which will allow the plugin to be attached to any world entity without knowing the name in advance.
update.title: Fallback to default plugin configuration
update.reason: Closing for the GitHub migration, ticketed issue #57.

content.raw: I think this needs to be updated
content.html: I think this needs to be updated

content.raw:
`${IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR}/server.config`

And how about changing the env var to something like `IGN_GAZEBO_SERVER_CONFIG` (more general than `SYSTEMS`)?
content.html:
${IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR}/server.config

And how about changing the env var to something like IGN_GAZEBO_SERVER_CONFIG (more general than SYSTEMS)?

content.raw:
`clang-tidy` doesn't like these:

```
ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/ServerConfig.hh:339:5: warning: invalid case style for global function 'ParsePluginsFromString' [readability-identifier-naming]
    ParsePluginsFromString(const std::string &_str);
    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    parsePluginsFromString
```

In the interest of parsing the entire server config in the future, instead of just the plugins, some other ideas would be:

* Return the entire config: `ServerConfig ParseFromFile(const std::string &_fname);`
* Update an existing config: `bool ParseFromFile(ServerConfig &_config, const std::string &_fname);`
* Implement as a member function: `bool ServerConfig::ParseFromFile(const std::string &_fname);`
content.html:
clang-tidy doesn't like these:

ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/ServerConfig.hh:339:5: warning: invalid case style for global function 'ParsePluginsFromString' [readability-identifier-naming]
    ParsePluginsFromString(const std::string &_str);
    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    parsePluginsFromString

In the interest of parsing the entire server config in the future, instead of just the plugins, some other ideas would be:

  • Return the entire config: ServerConfig ParseFromFile(const std::string &_fname);
  • Update an existing config: bool ParseFromFile(ServerConfig &_config, const std::string &_fname);
  • Implement as a member function: bool ServerConfig::ParseFromFile(const std::string &_fname);

content.raw:
I hadn’t considered that use case, but with the most recent commit, it will still load the default plugins from the  `${IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR}/server.config` at a minimum.

What do you think of having the environment variable set but empty as a mechanism for not loading any systems?
content.html:
I hadn’t considered that use case, but with the most recent commit, it will still load the default plugins from the ${IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR}/server.config at a minimum.

What do you think of having the environment variable set but empty as a mechanism for not loading any systems?

content.raw:
I didn’t study this PR in detail, but what would be the problem of allowing to start the server without any plugin? Users that use Gazebo as a library could trigger plugin loading after the creation of the `Server` object by emitting the right event \(for both world and model plugins\).

Think about the use case where downstream users want to load in this way a custom Physics system from their code. Would this be possible after this PR? \(without workarounds like empty `*.config` files\)
content.html:
I didn’t study this PR in detail, but what would be the problem of allowing to start the server without any plugin? Users that use Gazebo as a library could trigger plugin loading after the creation of the Server object by emitting the right event (for both world and model plugins).

Think about the use case where downstream users want to load in this way a custom Physics system from their code. Would this be possible after this PR? (without workarounds like empty *.config files)

content.raw:
It looks like the `systems.config` is not being used when starting `ign gazebo` without any world file. I think it's because it's picking up the systems from [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/939014abd905bdf5bd02176c09ce860e629f5d73/src/Server.cc#lines-36). I think it should use the file.

Also, mind adding a tutorial briefly describing all the ways in which the user can specify plugins?
content.html:
It looks like the systems.config is not being used when starting ign gazebo without any world file. I think it's because it's picking up the systems from here. I think it should use the file.

Also, mind adding a tutorial briefly describing all the ways in which the user can specify plugins?

content.raw: We should check `if (kNullEntity != entity)` before loading the plugin. Ignition is crashing if some bad combination is passed in.
content.html: We should check if (kNullEntity != entity) before loading the plugin. Ignition is crashing if some bad combination is passed in.

content.raw: Here you use `<root>`, but `systems.config` uses `<plugins>`
content.html: Here you use <root>, but systems.config uses <plugins>

content.raw: Missing `param[in]`
content.html: Missing param[in]

content.raw: I *think* the solution to this is checking `if (_sdf->HasElement("plugin"))` before calling `GetElement`, but I could be wrong
content.html: I think the solution to this is checking if (_sdf->HasElement("plugin")) before calling GetElement, but I could be wrong

content.raw: While looking at this, I was thinking whether it would be handy to have a config file which populates all the fields of `ServerConfig`, instead of just the plugins. Have you considered this? I wouldn't do it in this PR, but if we want to leave the way open for that, I think this file should be in the root folder instead of `systems` :thinking:
content.html: While looking at this, I was thinking whether it would be handy to have a config file which populates all the fields of ServerConfig, instead of just the plugins. Have you considered this? I wouldn't do it in this PR, but if we want to leave the way open for that, I think this file should be in the root folder instead of systems
